http://sourceforge.net/projects/antlreclipse version 4.0.0.b2

To simplify our code we've removed null checks where the API does not allow null. It looks like in this multi-page scenario EditorActionBarContributor.getActionBars() is returning 'null'.

Moving to Platform UI for comment.

This was a side-effect of work on bug 20831, but was fixed in bug 121866 when we re-ordered the events.

PW

Actually, I'm not convinced that this has been fixed.

I've done some further investigation, and it appears that the ANTLR multi page editor is not providing a subclass of MultiPageEditorActionBarContributor.  This would prevent it from working properly with the MultiPageEditorPart.

Some more investigation is needed.

Later,
PW

According to Gunnar this was worked around in new versions of the ANTLR plug-in. So you can close it out.
It should also work without a workaround in ANTLR.

As far as I can tell, the changes that were put in were to work around the fact that the editor action contributor didn't subclass  MultiPageEditorActionBarContributor.
